snippet.title: Sydney counter-terror raids: One man arrested over alleged plane 'bomb plot' released without charge
snippet.content: Australian Federal Police has released without charge one of four men arrested in counter-terror raids on Saturday over an alleged plan to bring down a commercial flight using a homemade bomb. One of the men, aged 50, was released from police custody last night. The other three men arrested during raids in Sydney suburbs including Lakema and Surry Hills remain in police custody under "specified time" detention powers. The investigation is ongoing. This is a breaking news story. More information will be added as it comes to hand. (C) Nine Digital Pty Ltd 2017
